summary: Foreign partners buy billions of dollars of defense items and services annually through the U.S. Foreign Military Sales program. DOD collects a transportation fee from buyers to cover shipping costs and pay shipping expenses. DOD’s financial oversight is supposed to ensure that money goes in and out of the transportation accounts appropriately. However, DOD’s oversight processes do not ensure that: annual reviews are routinely overseen...
title: Foreign Military Sales: DOD Should Further Strengthen Financial Oversight of Transportation Fees
